info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 17 at 1:38PM CDT until September 18 at 8:38AM CDT by NWS Goodland KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska...
Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County.
For the Frenchman Creek...including Culbertson...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Frenchman Creek near Culbertson.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Lowland areas near the vicinity of the gage will become flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM CDT Wednesday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 4.3 feet Saturday morning. It will then rise to 4.5 feet Sunday morning. It will fall to 4.4 feet Sunday evening then rise again. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 05/26/2023.
info.instruction:
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING
